intro: Serratula tinctoria subsp. seoanei, commonly known as the Canary Island serretula, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow to orange-yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing adaptations to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular florets arranged in a composite head. This subspecies is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
